pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw: I think all our current use cases have the `LoadPlugins` event (which calls `AddSystem`) being called from the same thread as the system updates, but I don't think we can guarantee this for too long. What do you think of protecting `pendingSystems` with a mutex?
content.html: I think all our current use cases have the LoadPlugins event (which calls AddSystem) being called from the same thread as the system updates, but I don't think we can guarantee this for too long. What do you think of protecting pendingSystems with a mutex?

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw: Good idea. I think we also have to protect the call to `systemLoader->LoadPlugin`. Can you think of anything else?
content.html: Good idea. I think we also have to protect the call to systemLoader->LoadPlugin. Can you think of anything else?

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw:
There are some test failures because systems are now only added after the first `SimulationRunner::Run`.

Maybe we could `ProcessSystemsQueue` once after the level manager creates the initial entities?
content.html:
There are some test failures because systems are now only added after the first SimulationRunner::Run.

Maybe we could ProcessSystemsQueue once after the level manager creates the initial entities?

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw: Yeah, I think we should do that. I will still have to change some of the tests in `Server_TEST.cc` so that they check `SystemCount` after calling `Run`. I'll also need to change the `SystemQueue` test in `SimulationRunner_TEST.cc` because if we call `ProcessSystemsQueue` in the constructor, that test will fail.
content.html: Yeah, I think we should do that. I will still have to change some of the tests in Server_TEST.cc so that they check SystemCount after calling Run. I'll also need to change the SystemQueue test in SimulationRunner_TEST.cc because if we call ProcessSystemsQueue in the constructor, that test will fail.

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw: Another alternative is to include the size of pending systems when returning from `SystemCount`. Then, none of the tests need to be modified. Thoughts?
content.html: Another alternative is to include the size of pending systems when returning from SystemCount. Then, none of the tests need to be modified. Thoughts?

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw: b29190e. I also removed the `SystemQueue` test because it's not testing anything that's not covered by other tests.
content.html: b29190e. I also removed the SystemQueue test because it's not testing anything that's not covered by other tests.

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw: All the changes look good to me, thanks! The segfault has been fixed on Homebrew, which I believe was the goal of the PR; we can tackle the remaining failures in another PR.
content.html: All the changes look good to me, thanks! The segfault has been fixed on Homebrew, which I believe was the goal of the PR; we can tackle the remaining failures in another PR.

pullrequest.title: Add systems to queue before actually adding them to runner

content.raw:
Just for reference, this is one of the last 2 test failures:

~~~
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:295] Model [white_box] touched [green_box_for_white] exclusively for 3 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:214] Stopped touch plugin [white_touches_only_green]
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:207] Started touch plugin [white_touches_only_green]
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:281] Model [white_box] started touching [green_box_for_white] at 7.201 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:267] Not touching anything
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:281] Model [white_box] started touching [green_box_for_white] at 8.721 s
71: /Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/ign-gazebo/test/integration/touch_plugin.cc:105: Failure
71: Value of: whiteTouched
71:   Actual: false
71: Expected: true
71: [  FAILED  ] TouchPluginTest.OneLink (10580 ms)
~~~

This is how it looks like on success:

~~~
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:295] Model [white_box] touched [green_box_for_white] exclusively for 3 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:214] Stopped touch plugin [white_touches_only_green]
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:207] Started touch plugin [white_touches_only_green]
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:281] Model [white_box] started touching [green_box_for_white] at 7.201 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:295] Model [white_box] touched [green_box_for_white] exclusively for 3 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:214] Stopped touch plugin [white_touches_only_green]
71: [       OK ] TouchPluginTest.OneLink (3370 ms)
~~~

The difference is that on homebrew, the white box stops touching the green box after > 7.2 s.

content.raw:
This is the 2nd failure, looks similar:

~~~
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:281] Model [blue_box] started touching [green_box_for_blue] at 3.001 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:295] Model [white_box] touched [green_box_for_white] exclusively for 3 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:214] Stopped touch plugin [white_touches_only_green]
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:267] Not touching anything
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:281] Model [blue_box] started touching [green_box_for_blue] at 3.855 s
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:267] Not touching anything
71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:281] Model [blue_box] started touching [green_box_for_blue] at 5.476 s
71: /Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/ign-gazebo/test/integration/touch_plugin.cc:182: Failure
71: Value of: blueTouched
71:   Actual: false
71: Expected: true
71: [  FAILED  ] TouchPluginTest.StartDisabled (7071 ms)
~~~

Success looks like:

71: [Dbg] [TouchPlugin.cc:214] Stopped touch plugin [blue_touches_only_green]
71: [       OK ] TouchPluginTest.StartDisabled (1900 ms)
~~~
